alert.note: Alert for Ozark; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Ozark and southeastern Taney Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 815 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Diamond City, or 13 miles southeast of Forsyth, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bull Shoals Lake, Lake Taneycomo, Protem and Rueter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southwestern Missouri.
